ios.subtitle: Guess the word with video chat

editorialNotes.standard: Awesome reaction emoji! Strategy-smashing Nope cards! The fur truly flies in this slick adaptation of the zany card game.

Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and soundâand a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, itâs surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.

name: THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip

editorialNotes.tagline: Twist on a classic board game

editorialNotes.standard: Whatâs made OLO game one of our multiplayer favorites since 2012? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for pointsâand slyly knocking an opponentâs discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennepâs all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.

editorialNotes.tagline: Can you pull off the heist?

editorialNotes.standard: Noodles is the kind of game that can completely flummox us for minutes at a time. And then, one second later, the entire puzzle reveals itself. Itâs never very easy, but the overwhelming sense of accomplishment we get when we solve a puzzle makes it all worth it.
